lead_paragraph: The central bank chairwoman told senators that data on the labor market and the weak pace of investment indicated that domestic demand “might falter.”

headline.print_headline: Growth Weak, Fed Chairwoman Signals No Hurry to Raise Interest Rates
headline.main: Janet Yellen Hints That Fed May Hold Back on Raising Interest Rates

snippet: The central bank chairwoman told senators that data on the labor market and the weak pace of investment indicated that domestic demand “might falter.”
abstract: Federal Reserve chairwoman Janet L Yellen testifies before Senate Banking Committee that weak economic growth could compel Fed to delay any increases in interest rates for near future; expresses optimism about economic outlook in coming years, but concedes that growth may not match pre-recession levels.
